Where Can I Watch Croatian TV Online?

Most Croatian TV is only licensed to stream in Croatia. If you try to watch Croatian TV channels outside of Croatia, they’ll block you by detecting your location through your IP address. Streaming services like Sportska Televizija will present an error message like this:

“Nalazite se izvan granica RH ili imamo tehničkih poteškoća”

If you’re in the US and want to watch some Croatian content, you might find some on US streaming platforms like Sling TV and KrowdTV. However, the choice is quite limited.

Connect to a nearby Croatian server. After installing the app, open it and select a Croatian server — if there’s more than one location, choose the one closest to your location in Croatia for the best speeds.

Many older smart TVs and streaming devices like Roku don't support native VPN apps. So you’ll need to install the VPN on your router. While the setup is a bit more technical, most VPNs have detailed guides on how to do it. All the VPNs on my list are compatible with popular routers and come with setup guides.

Sign up for a VPN. Pick one that's compatible with your router. For Asus, Linksys, or Netgear routers, ExpressVPN is a good choice. It has a custom router firmware and a router app that makes connecting easier.

Configure the VPN on your router. Find the setup guide specific to your VPN and router and follow it. After setup, all devices on that router will be protected by the VPN.

Connect to a local server. To watch Croatian content from Croatia, you’ll need to use a server that’s within the country. Choose the one nearest to you for the best speeds possible.

FAQs on Watching Croatian TV Online With a VPN

Is it possible to watch Croatian TV for free?

Yes, some Croatian TV channels, like RTL Televizija, Nova TV, and HRT 1, offer free online streams. While these sites are reputable and safe to use, keep in mind that some sites may not be so trustworthy and secure.

I don’t recommend browsing streaming sites that you’re unfamiliar with, but if you accidentally do, you should at least protect your personal data while doing so. The best way to secure your connections in Croatia is with a reliable VPN that offers Croatian servers and robust security features.

The most reliable VPNs for streaming Croatian TV in Croatia require a paid subscription. However, at least you can test them without risk — almost any reputable VPN offers a money-back guarantee.

Most Croatian TV channels are only available to watch within Croatia. Hypothetically, a VPN can help you watch Croatian TV from the USA, Canada, Australia, or anywhere else, but I don’t recommend it. VPNs offer strong privacy features to keep you safe when you go online, so it’s OK to use one while streaming Croatian content — but only if you’re in Croatia and connected to a server in the country.

However, using a VPN to bypass geo-restrictions imposed by Croatian TV channels is not OK. This practice goes against the platforms’ T&Cs and might lead to copyright infringement. The team and I at vpnMentor don’t condone this, so make sure you follow all the streaming rules and laws when using a VPN.

No, it’s not entirely legal to watch Croatian TV in the US with a VPN. Using a VPN to hypothetically bypass geo-restrictions imposed by content providers might breach their terms of service and can be seen as copyright infringement. You’re entirely responsible for how you use a VPN, so ensure you know the terms of any streaming platform you use and the copyright laws.

However, if you have Sling TV in the US, you might find some Croatian channels there that you can watch. If you also want to protect your connection while streaming and avoid ISP throttling in the US, then you need to connect to a US server for Sling TV.

Yes, there are a few Croatian channels offered on US platforms. For instance, Sling TV and KlowdTV offer a selection of Croatian content, but the variety is limited. You won’t get as broad of a range of Croatian TV channels as you’ll get from within Croatia.

Is it possible to watch Croatian soccer live abroad?

No — due to broadcasting limitations, you can mostly watch Croatian sports and entertainment channels in Croatia. Technically, you could use a VPN to change your virtual location and hypothetically stream Croatian soccer like you’re there, but this goes against the channels’ Terms of Service and can lead to copyright infringement. So I don't recommend it.

Can I use a free VPN to watch Croatian TV online?

Yes, but I don’t recommend free VPNs, as they’re often unreliable and can even be dangerous. Free VPNs limit server networks to save money, meaning you might not be able to even find one with a Croatian server. A premium VPN with a trustworthy money-back guarantee is a more reliable option for getting fast speeds, unlimited data, and a selection of Croatian servers. That way, you can watch Croatian TV from Croatia safely in HD.

Free VPNs often restrict your bandwidth and streaming speeds, leading to slow, interrupted streams that can spoil your viewing experience. They can also compromise your privacy by logging and selling your data to advertisers or other third parties. There are also instances where free VPNs have been found to contain harmful malware, posing a risk to your device and data.
